description: Retrieves all scaling policies applied to a fleet. To get a fleet's scaling policies, specify the fleet ID. You can filter this request by policy status, such as to retrieve only active scaling policies. Use the pagination parameters to retrieve results as a set of sequential pages. If successful, set of ScalingPolicy objects is returned for the fleet. A fleet may have all of its scaling policies suspended. This operation does not affect the status of the scaling policies, which remains ACTIVE.

parameters.name: FleetId
parameters.description: A unique identifier for the fleet for which to retrieve scaling policies. You can use either the fleet ID or ARN value.

parameters.name: StatusFilter
parameters.description: Scaling policy status to filter results on. A scaling policy is only in force when in an ACTIVE status. ACTIVE --- The scaling policy is currently in force. UPDATEREQUESTED --- A request to update the scaling policy has been received. UPDATING --- A change is being made to the scaling policy. DELETEREQUESTED --- A request to delete the scaling policy has been received. DELETING --- The scaling policy is being deleted. DELETED --- The scaling policy has been deleted. ERROR --- An error occurred in creating the policy. It should be removed and recreated.

nested_items.name: ScalingPolicies
nested_items.description: A collection of objects containing the scaling policies matching the request.

nested_items.name: FleetId
nested_items.description: A unique identifier for the fleet that is associated with this scaling policy.

nested_items.name: FleetArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name ( ARN) that is assigned to a Amazon GameLift fleet resource and uniquely identifies it. ARNs are unique across all Regions. Format is arn:aws:gamelift:<region>::fleet/fleet-a1234567-b8c9-0d1e-2fa3-b45c6d7e8912.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: A descriptive label that is associated with a fleet's scaling policy. Policy names do not need to be unique.

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: Current status of the scaling policy. The scaling policy can be in force only when in an ACTIVE status. Scaling policies can be suspended for individual fleets. If the policy is suspended for a fleet, the policy status does not change.

nested_items.name: ScalingAdjustment
nested_items.description: Amount of adjustment to make, based on the scaling adjustment type.

nested_items.name: ScalingAdjustmentType
nested_items.description: The type of adjustment to make to a fleet's instance count.

nested_items.name: ComparisonOperator
nested_items.description: Comparison operator to use when measuring a metric against the threshold value.

nested_items.name: Threshold
nested_items.description: Metric value used to trigger a scaling event.

nested_items.name: EvaluationPeriods
nested_items.description: Length of time (in minutes) the metric must be at or beyond the threshold before a scaling event is triggered.

nested_items.name: MetricName
nested_items.description: Name of the Amazon GameLift-defined metric that is used to trigger a scaling adjustment. For detailed descriptions of fleet metrics, see Monitor Amazon GameLift with Amazon CloudWatch.

nested_items.name: PolicyType
nested_items.description: The type of scaling policy to create. For a target-based policy, set the parameter MetricName to --PercentAvailableGameSessions' and specify a TargetConfiguration. For a rule-based policy set the following parameters: MetricName, ComparisonOperator, Threshold, EvaluationPeriods, ScalingAdjustmentType, and ScalingAdjustment.

nested_items.name: TargetConfiguration
nested_items.description: An object that contains settings for a target-based scaling policy.

nested_items.name: TargetValue
nested_items.description: Desired value to use with a target-based scaling policy. The value must be relevant for whatever metric the scaling policy is using. For example, in a policy using the metric PercentAvailableGameSessions, the target value should be the preferred size of the fleet's buffer (the percent of capacity that should be idle and ready for new game sessions).

nested_items.name: UpdateStatus
nested_items.description: The current status of the fleet's scaling policies in a requested fleet location. The status PENDING_UPDATE indicates that an update was requested for the fleet but has not yet been completed for the location.

nested_items.name: NextToken
nested_items.description: A token that indicates where to resume retrieving results on the next call to this operation. If no token is returned, these results represent the end of the list.
